bibl.title: Some Proposals on a Second Century A.D. Prose Fragment.
bibl.note: Re-edition of P. Oxy. IV, 683 (= Pack2 2859). The first three preserved lines of the fragment could be identified as a passage from ISOCRATES, Philippus 97-98. It could be assumed that an event from the story of Pharax is described in the papyrus.
LITINAS Nikos, Some Proposals on a Second Century A.D. Prose Fragment.
